title: Ranked MVP reward system implementation ideas
body:
To whom it may concern,

Hi Riot,

I've been a player for 3-4 consecutive years, and here's some feedback i would like to pass on.

Don't you think the #1 problem in the ranked system today is players complaining about not being rewarded for trying very hard throughout games? How about rewarding most valuable players (MVP) per game on the losing team so they either:

1. Able to get the same equivalent points as the winning team players do.
2. Don't lose any points so they don't give up playing or feel sad for trying their best but not being able to pull through.

Now, you may say but how do we accomplish this? How are we able to reward players without personally seeing their efforts or what system do we implement that is of value.

Here's an idea, you could allow the winning team to vote (1) player on the losing team as (MVP) and that player is able to be rewarded for their efforts. I know you have tried by implementing the ribbon system, which to an extent has made players more excited for their contribution to the league but over a period of time this fades, being a ribbon it only distinguishes players apart from others and sometimes labeled the "sheep of riot".

Warmly, Malia

Discuss?




Edit (1): 

I agree with; that there should be a reward, although the possibility on the draw of the voting. Thank you for bringing this up!!

Could we say, if people were to abuse the system and 1 vote was on each player example:

Losing team:

Player 1: 1 Votes
Player 2: 1 Votes
Player 3: 1 Votes
Player 4 : 1 Votes
Player 5: 1 Votes

In this case, no body is rewarded if players were to do this they would have to rethink the morality as the same would happen to them if they were caught on the losing team.

Could we say, if 2 players each received 2 votes each player example:

Losing team:
Player 1: 0 Votes
Player 2: 2 Votes
Player 3: 1 Votes
Player 4: 2 Votes
Player 5: 0 Votes

In this case, the vote is re-drawn and the winning team has to then pick between players 2 and 4. Now with the ratio being 5 votes and every player has to vote once the odd number variable would conclude a player receiving a reward. (no LP loss) or (LP gain equivalent to winning team's per player LP gain. 

Could we share this, i think we're on to something guys,

Yes, i agree with you,

But, very big but here, 

Do you see any potential in upcoming players from gold-plat, even silver with amazing individual mechanics?

Could you see these players^ playing in a high tier with their skill level being an addition to the league and overall boosting the skill-cap of tiers across the world?

You're absolutely right that there are players that have found a way to overcome it but others are stuck in this mental gap or bridge.

Personally, myself, being a player of a high tier at a certain point in time managed to scramble 'solo queue ranking' players of no-where near the diamond border to place 4th on the go4lol ladders.

Avant, Fray, iM - The old lineup of these teams (Challenger top 100 standings per player) (Solo-queue)

Not only was this team able to barely make top 4, the next 10-15 teams standings behind us were all ranked diamond+ individually. 

A player from gambit got picked up standing gold-plat (old-elo system) into a team of 'quality' diamond solo queue rankings and brought one of the top teams out of Europe to challenge other teams across the world.

If you don't have connections, If you can't pass a simple mental gap of the ranking system, If your name isn't placed top 100 on the server your chances of competing are limited.

We're missing players that are capable or have the potential they are able to provide a unique play-style to bring to the table, only because the system is negating these players to give up too early due to 'AFK's, Disconnects, Unskilled, Internet problems, Lag, Intentionally giving the other team a overhauling advantage by deaths,

A simple fix or resolution to this, anything really to give the player a reward; a gateway to keep pushing through will spark the exquisite potential of the competitive scene in a way that we've never seen before.
Howie about that person doesn't lost points every 3 mbps they get? Something like that

even this is a good idea. Players shouldn't be held back by their team. I've seen some great players who play better than higher elo players yet they are stuck in the lower elo bracket. Riot should implement a way or this way to reward player who try hard to get where they want to be. WTF are ribbons going to do?

Yeah no, don't give them LP for losing, even the no LP loss is a bit much since you'd have to force people to vote (and they are likely to vote a "stomping" player over a player who did well)

Honestly a system that only works if your paying attention to every lane/opponent the whole game rather then just your own lane opponent.

Not when you have to think for 4 other players on your team it doesn't work. One thing I've noticed, is there is a huge lack of common sense in this region thus the reason why "Love you malia" has brought this to the attention of the community. Rewarding players who played well but on a %%%% team, hell yeah why wouldn't you. I feel for players who are solid but due to riots broken system are held back by their teams.

That's not riot's system being broken, that's people's thinking being broken.

Your not playing 1v5, the skills of both teams are roughly even.

And "played well" is relative, i can play well but still be a low KDA because i'm still trying to win, whereas someone in the same game who did shit all can be a high KDA because they only looked at getting kills.

Yeah, definitely KDA is no measure of how well a player does, players in the game should be able to notice that

It's not broken but it can be rewired to up the competitive entertainment

The problem is that To vote for someone on the enemy team that's done well, you'd have to go by KDA generally over actual performance cause your focus is yourself and not necessarily your enemies in other lanes.

Edit: Maybe instead of instantly awarding the player that get's most votes for MVP.

Make it like a every 2 games players get rewarded, this will diminish the duo favoring the player that they know and abusing the system.

**Problem we are trying to overcome:** Reoccurring loss streak even when players are playing to their maximum potential.

Just thought of another problem with this method:

Duo's or party's in ranked consisting of 2 players that know another person or is in the same team ie SKT.

Will most likely abuse this for voting for their team member to not lose LP.
I lost a game but gained LP because i went extremely positive, that is reward enough the fact that i gained LP when normally one would lose it

For a player to receive RP equivalent in a small scale it's not a noticeable enough rate to encourage players to try their best per game.

Player 5: 0 Votes

In this case, the vote is re-drawn and the winning team has to then pick between players 2 and 4. Now with the ratio being 5 votes and every player has to vote once the odd number variable would conclude a player receiving a reward. (no LP loss) or (LP gain equivalent to winning team's per player LP gain. 

Could we share this, i think we're on to something guys,

**I don't think that a reward should consist of LP. **
A more suitable system would be a small IP reward, or perhaps an accumulation of a new currency that can be redeemed for RP. 

**For example:** A player receives the most votes and becomes the losing teams MVP (if there is a draw between players with MVP votes, the vote becomes void and no-one gets the benefit. This would be to prevent abuse of the system). The MVP player could receive 50 currency points. Upon reaching a particular number of currency points (maybe a converter in the store or something) the player is then able to convert x currency to x RP (at an exchange rate the Riot could control, probably something like 2 points=1 RP). This way, it would take consistent good behaviour from a player to actually reap rewards. Instead of being a toxic wasteland, ranked might become a nice-fest.

Of course, this system would only be available in ranked because ranked seems to be more toxic than normals as well as being more competitive. 

Players in normals could just have a small ip incentive that works off the same 'end of game loser MVP voting' premise.
